pageContext.title: In brief: Top crypto exchange Binance invests $2.5m in Australian blockchain startup
pageContext.content:
Cryptocurrency exchange Binance today announced it is investing over US$2.5 million in Australian startup TravelbyBit. Binance will work with TravelbyBit to introduce a global point-of-sale (POS) payment system, integrating blockchain technology into major airports around the world.

At selected international airports such as in Brisbane, travelers will now be able to visit merchants and pay with digital currency.

TravelbyBit currently supports payments in Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Litecoin, and will soon support Binance Coin. Binance will help generate interest among its users to travel to Australia and paying with digital currency.

Source: Press release

Binance is the top cryptocurrency exchange in the world by trading volume, according to CoinMarketCap. It has transacted US$884 million worth of currency in the past 24 hours. The company has launched its own incubation program in a bid to create a blockchain ecosystem and encourage widespread adoption of cryptocurrency.

In addition to the investment from Binance, TravelbyBit has also secured US$70,000 from the Advance Queensland Ignite Ideas grant.
